metadata.subject: SPX put contingent on higher rates

organizations: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Incorporated
locations: One Bryant Park, 5th Floor, New York, NY 10036

relationships.description: Financial advisor providing investment advice to client
Colleagues or both recipients of financial advice

transactions: SPX Apr-17 95% put conditional on US 10Y CMS > 2.5%

analysis.purpose: To provide investment advice and hedging strategies following Trump election volatility
analysis.significance: Shows financial advisory relationship and investment strategies being discussed post-2016 election

notable_quotes: We are recording unprecedented divergences in falling equity vol with rising rates vol post Trump's win.
Stabilizing rates volatility from here is key to markets remaining calm and while equity upside may continue, it is not without higher risks
We like cheap optionality to hedge long-equities if rates continue to move sharply

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - purely professional financial communication

illegal_activity.description: Document contains legitimate financial analysis and investment advice with no illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Standard financial market analysis following 2016 US election - similar analysis was widely available through financial media outlets

analysis.summary: Amanda Ens from Bank of America Merrill Lynch sends investment advice to Jeffrey Epstein and Richard Kahn regarding post-Trump election market volatility, recommending SPX put options contingent on interest rates as a hedging strategy for equity portfolios.
